position.marginalia_text: floruit a[nn]o 1150 sub Anglo[rum] rege Stephano.

emphasis.text: floruit a[nn]o 1150 sub Anglo[rum] rege Stephano.

marginalia.translation: Flourished in the year 1150 under Stephen, king of the English.

position.marginalia_text: Caradocus Lancarnavensis istius Galfredi conterraneus et synchronus, Reguloru[m] Brytannico[rum] successiones post morte[m] Cadwalladri regis, per 460 ferè annos cum magna diligentia descripsit. Baleus.

marginalia.translation: Caradocus of Llancarfan, countryman and contemporary of this Geoffrey of Monmouth, described the successions of British princes for almost 460 years after the death of king Cadwaladr with great diligence. Baleus.

position.marginalia_text: Nennius Bannochorensis collegij po[n]tifex scripsit de origine Brytanno[rum] de vrbibus eorunde[m] Cosmographia[m] historia[e] mundi Alterius Nennij chronico[n] in Latinam vert[it] floruit sub Caduuano Brytanno[rum] Duce a[nn]o à Chr[ist]o incarnato 620

book.title: Scriptorum illustrium maioris Brytannie quam nunc Angliam & Scotiam vocant catalogus

marginalia.translation: Nennius of Bangor, priest of the high college, wrote "De origine Britannorum"; "De urbibus eorundem (i.e. Britannorum)"; and "Cosmographia historiae mundi". He translated the chronicle of the other Nennius (i.e. Nennius Audax) into Latin. Flourished under Caduanus, leader of the Britons in the year after the Incarnation 620.

position.marginalia_text: Samuel Beulanius, scripsit annotatio[n]es in Nenniu[m] et Historia[m] itineraria[m] Arthuri facta apud Scotos floruit sub Cadwallone [deleted Brytannor[um]] Brytanno[rum] duce A[nn]o 640

book.title: Scriptorum illustrium maioris Brytannie quam nunc Angliam & Scotiam vocant catalogus

marginalia.translation: Samuel Beulanius wrote "Annotationes in Nennium"; "Historia itineraria"; and "Arthuri facta apud Scotos". Flourished under Cadwallon, leader of the Britons, in the year 640.

position.marginalia_text: Baleus { Huius ac Nennij hucvsq[ue] manent historia[e] inter tot bello[rum] clades, [q]uamvis a Beda et Polydoro (scriptoru[m] raritate[m] crimina[n]tib[us]) no[n] vis[ae]

book.title: Scriptorum illustrium maioris Brytannie quam nunc Angliam & Scotiam vocant catalogus

marginalia.translation: John Bale: Samuel Beulanius's history and that of Nennius during such devastation of wars remain to this day, but (owing to the rarity of the works) they were not seen by Bede and Polydore Vergil.
